description.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities, which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 1: Mother and child survival, growth and development and Programme Component Results (PCR) 2: Protective and learning environment

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygieneespecially for the most deprived communities

No. of states with monitoring frameworks for sanitation and hygiene service delivery (emphasises achievement of targets, actions and budget lines that demonstrate reach to the most deprived communities, and with reliable national verification)

baseline.value: Not all states have all aspects of the national guidelines currently in place

target.value: 2017:15 states meet all aspects of the National Guidelines

actual.value: 2014:2. This indicator is constrained as a result of the slow if steady progress governments are making in implementing the sanitation programme. title.narrative: No. of states implementing national sanitation guidelines

baseline.value: Some or no states have all aspects of the guidelines currently in place

target.value: 2017:15 states meet all aspects of the National Guidelines

actual.value: 2014:1. In 2014 the three states without a state SHACS, Bihar, Chhattisgarh, and Odisha have developed state SHACS, held state workshops and are now planning for roll-out.
